asset.notes: Following enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Personally owned.

availability.notes: records were removed from the USF Physician Group office.

confidentiality.notes: Information available states that Tampa General hospital, where the patients were treated, had a policy to provide credit monitoring.  However, it appears that USF officials only recommend patients monitor their credit.

summary: A custodial employee of USF Health was found to have in there possession, personal information of 140 patients including: names, dates of birth and social security numbers. The records were found in the employees car during a traffic stop.  USF has not received any indication that personal information has been used by any unauthorized persons.  However, they are recommending affected patients monitor their credit as a precaution.
